Welcome to the
Open Navigation Foundation
About Us

Our Mission

Our mission is to develop and support a vibrant ecosystem of robotics capabilities and applications. We plan to do this in two ways:

  1. It is our goal to organize a self-sustaining ecosystem through a community-focused mindset by advocating for open collaboration, providing abundant resources, and lowering the barrier of entry.
  2. We seek to partner with industry and academia to create high-quality robotics technologies and help organizations leverage the power of open tools for their applications.

Our Vision

Our vision is to create a dynamic ecosystem of robotics capabilities and resources to empower creators to shape the future through democratising access and open collaboration.

Projects

Our mission is to support pivotal open-source projects for the mobile and manipulation robotics communities. Below is a sample of the projects we maintain, developed, and are experts in. If there's a project important to your organization you would like developed or supported, please contact us.

ROS2 Navigation

Mobile Robotics

SLAM Toolbox

Mapping and Localization

Multi-Sensor Fusion

Our Members

Services

We also offer services around robotics development and consulting. These activities typically orbit open-source projects, but Open Navigation is open to proprietary feature development to fuel our mission. We offer a discount to member companies and projects that may be made open-source.

ROS Consulting and Development

ROS2 is the standard for robotics development and we're some of the leading experts on it. ROS can be hard and we understand. We offer consulting services make it easier. Whether you need a ROS-based system developed, move your codebase to ROS, or convert your ROS system to ROS2, we have you covered.

Robotics Research & Development

We conduct R&D tasks for organizations in need of seasoned roboticists and engineers. Our team is comprised of creators and maintainers of widely used robot navigation software. We are also uniquely suited to set up or make your enhancements to projects such as Navigation, RViz, Gazebo, MoveIt, and more.

Education and Setup

Open Navigation is a leader in open-source robotics technologies. We offer programs to get your team up and running quickly. We conduct seminars, create on-boarding programs and interactive tutorials, and help set up your team for success.

Contact Us

ROS2 Navigation

Navigation framework and solution for ROS2. A highly tested and robust navigation framework specifically designed to be extended by the user. Provides capabilities for waypoint navigation, multi-robot navigation, and navigating through large and dynamic environments autonomously. It provides a large suite of tools and tutorials for new users and seasoned developers alike.

  • Date: 2019 to Present
  • GitHub Repo: ros-planning/navigation2

SLAM Toolbox

SLAM Toolbox is a 2D multi-session SLAM package built for large and dynamic environments such as retail, warehouse, factories, and outdoors. It is built using a modified version of the Open Karto library and provides a localization mode and several processing methods. It was selected by the ROS2 Technical Steering Committee to be the default supported SLAM for ROS2.

  • Date: 2019 to Present
  • GitHub Repo: SteveMacenski/slam_toolbox

PCL Perception

ROS and ROS2 interfaces to the PointCloud Library (PCL). Contains tools to convert and work with ROS messages in PCL as well as tools to use PCL capabilities as building blocks for an application.

  • Date: 2013 To Present
  • GitHub Repo: ros-perception/perception_pcl

Spatio-Temporal Voxel Layer

3D perception costmap representation for highly dynamic environments. Uses novel data structured from Dreamworks animations applied to robotics for this real-time obstacle representation method. It is designed for robots processing multiple high-resolution sensors and substantially reduces resources compared to other state of the art solutions.

  • Date: 2018 to 2019
  • GitHub Repo: SteveMacenski/spatio_temporal_voxel_layer

Image Pipeline & OpenCV

ROS and ROS2 tools for working with RGB and RGB-D cameras including viewing tools, stereo image correlation, depth image processing, and more. Many of these capabilities are built on top of vision_opencv, which we also support and built with OpenCV. Image courtasy of the wiki.

  • Date: 2013 To Present
  • GitHub Repo: ros-perception/perception_pcl

Robot Localization

Robot Localization is a state estimation package designed to work with any number of sensors. It fuses these sensors with non-linear techniques and provides a smoothed state estimate. It can work with IMU, GPS, Odometry, external sensors, and more. Image courtasy of the documentation.

  • Date: 2015 To Present
  • GitHub Repo: cra-ros-pkg/robot_localization
